com.discretix.drmdlc.api
Interface IDxRightsInfo

public interface IDxRightsInfo

This interface is used to view the Rights information of a DRM license. The class offers a read-only interface. This product contains technology subject to certain intellectual property rights of Microsoft. Use or distribution of this technology outside of this product is prohibited without the appropriate license(s) from Microsoft.

Author:
Discretix

          Query function that returns the current count granted by the count constraint of the Rights Object.

          Query function that returns the end date of the rights object.

Method Detail

getStatus

IDxRightsInfo.RightsStatus getStatus()
A Getter function of the status of the Right object.

Returns:
RightsStatus - Valid or Future rights may be returned.

hasTimeConstraint

boolean hasTimeConstraint()
Query function that indicates whether Rights object has a time constrain.

Returns:
True if the rights object has a time constraint o/w false.

hasIntervalConstraint

boolean hasIntervalConstraint()
Query function that indicates whether Rights object has an interval constrain.

Returns:
True if the rights object has an interval constraint o/w false.
Note:
The interval license indicates the number of seconds allowed from the first time the content is played., Once content is played an interval constraint will be switched to time constraint with the start date equal to the first time content was played.

hasCountConstraint

boolean hasCountConstraint()
Query function that indicates whether Rights object has a count constrain.

Returns:
True if the rights object has a count constraint o/w false.

getStartTime

java.util.Date getStartTime()
Query function that returns the start date of the rights object. It applies only for rights with time constraint.

Returns:
Start date object or null if rights object has no time constraint.

getEndTime

java.util.Date getEndTime()
Query function that returns the end date of the rights object. It applies only for rights with time constraint.

Returns:
End date object or null if rights object has no time constraint.

getIntervalPeriodInSeconds

long getIntervalPeriodInSeconds()
Query function that returns the number of seconds left in the interval of the rights object. It applies only for rights with interval constraint.

Returns:
number of seconds in the interval or (-1) if rights object has no time interval constraint.
Note:
The interval license indicates the number of seconds allowed from the first time the content is played., Once content is played an interval constraint will be switched to time constraint with the start date equal to the first time content was played.

getInitialCount

long getInitialCount()
Query function that returns the initial count granted by the count constraint of the Rights Object.

Returns:
number of initial count or (-1) if rights object has no count constraint.

getCountLeft

long getCountLeft()
Query function that returns the current count granted by the count constraint of the Rights Object.

Returns:
number of current count or (-1) if rights object has no count constraint.
